body_html: I use Ubuntu. I think this problem comes with initial state when using dynamic rnn. If we use just dtype from dynamic_rnn(..., dtype=tf.float32) (which means not using user-defined initial state), tf.Saver() doens't save dynamic rnn last state.
body_text: I use Ubuntu. I think this problem comes with initial state when using dynamic rnn. If we use just dtype from dynamic_rnn(..., dtype=tf.float32) (which means not using user-defined initial state), tf.Saver() doens't save dynamic rnn last state.
body: I use Ubuntu. I think this problem comes with initial state when using dynamic rnn. If we use just `dtype` from `dynamic_rnn(..., dtype=tf.float32)` (which means not using user-defined initial state), `tf.Saver()` doens't save dynamic rnn last state.
